"How do you prove your identity in an agentic world ? Considering developments in payments, what solutions can be envisioned to ensure trust? Blockchain, other alternatives " ?

7ï¸âƒ£ Periodic table of ML ğŸ§¬
In a recent MIT weekly news, it referred to a periodic table of machine learning that shows how more than 20 classical algorithms are connected. The new framework sheds light on how scientists could fuse strategies from different methods to improve existing AI models or come up with new ones. link to article is https://news.mit.edu/2025/machine-learning-periodic-table-could-fuel-ai-discovery-0423
ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸Question here is can you walk us through this AI periodic table and demonstrate how one might use it ?

Q. Do you have initial thoughts on the OpenAI acquisition of Jony Iveâ€™s Startup IO for $6.5Bn this week?

9ï¸âƒ£ AI agents: reliability & flexibility ğŸ§©
Whatâ€™s the current state of AI agents in terms of reliability and safety? Iâ€™m curious to understand whether agents are already trustworthy enough to be deployed for specific tasks (like assistance, automation, or analysis), or if there are still major limitations to keep in mind.
Also, to what extent can an agent handle different types of functions or adapt to new contexts without losing accuracy? How flexible are they really when it comes to performing a variety of tasks?

ğŸ”Ÿ Multi-agent governance & safety âš–ï¸
What will be the key challenges and, therefore, necessary aspects of governance and guardrails to ensure trust, compliance, and safety (e.g. regarding authentication and authorization for payments) â€“ especially when multiple agents interact?

1ï¸âƒ£ AI in healthcare layers & trust ğŸ§¢
On the emerging AI abstraction pyramidâ€”from foundational models to agents to domain-specific applicationsâ€”where do healthcare systems fit, and what technical and ethical safeguards are essential at each layer to ensure medical accuracy, accountability, and patient trust (both in physical diagnosis and in mental-health chatbots)?

2ï¸âƒ£ Cognitive offloading & AI ğŸ§ 
How do we balance AI and cognitive offloading?

3ï¸âƒ£ AI ROI: probabilistic modeling ğŸ“Š
Q: Given that most organizations struggle with AI ROI measurement. What emerging best practices are you seeing in industry for probabilistic ROI modeling that accounts for AI-specific uncertainties?

4ï¸âƒ£ Real vs FOMO transformation ğŸŒ€
Many organizations label â€˜AI digital transformationâ€™ what in practice is little more than swapping Google for ChatGPT. How can enterprises recognize when theyâ€™re genuinely transforming, rather than just adding AI to outdated workflows and for FOMO?

5ï¸âƒ£ Self-teaching AI & human oversight ğŸ¤–
As self-teaching AI systems like Tsinghua Universityâ€™s â€œAbsolute Zeroâ€ begin to generate and solve tasks independently of human data, are we approaching a paradigm where human oversight becomes symbolic rather than substantiveâ€”and if so, what new frameworks of accountability and trust must we imagine for a future where AI evolves beyond our comprehension?

6ï¸âƒ£ Measuring AI ROI in creativity ğŸ¨
What frameworks are you using to evaluate AI ROI for this community?
And a broader question: what frameworks could be used to evaluate AI ROI beyond the typical productivity metrics, in creative industries where value is harder to quantify?

7ï¸âƒ£ Leading communities in GenAI era ğŸ§­
How do you lead communities in the GenAI age?
Any tips or tricks which can be shared?

8ï¸âƒ£ Community roadmap: next 12â€“18 months ğŸ›£ï¸
Where do you see the Gen AI Global community in the next 12â€“18 months, and what measurable progress or impact are we aiming for?

9ï¸âƒ£ External impact & visibility plan ğŸŒ
How is the community planning to expand its visibility and impact with leaders and (corporate) senior managers beyond the community members in the long run?

ğŸ”Ÿ Learning beyond coding ğŸ“š
Will there be continued opportunities for learning in other areas similar to the non-coding learning paths?

2ï¸âƒ£ Community-building challenges ğŸ§±
What has been the most challenging part of building this community?

3ï¸âƒ£ Member roles & responsibilities ğŸ¯

4ï¸âƒ£ Future of the community ğŸ”®

5ï¸âƒ£ Origin story of MIT GenAI ğŸŒ±
Dear Oscar, what sparked the idea to create the MIT Gen AI Community, and what key moment or need triggered you to turn that idea into reality?

6ï¸âƒ£ ISO-like governance in AI ğŸ“œ
In dynamic AI environments, how can we implement ISO-like governance frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 42001) without stifling agility and innovation?
What are key design patterns that balance certifiability with adaptiveness?

7ï¸âƒ£ GenAI for employee productivity ğŸ‘¥
How can companies adopt Generative AI to enhance employee productivity and engagement â€” without creating fear of job displacement?

8ï¸âƒ£ Multimodal AI ethics & cues ğŸ§ 
As AI-driven multimodal interfaces become more fluent and human-like, how can we ensure users don't mistake these systems' responses for true understanding or agency?
What ethical responsibilities arise in shaping the cues of collaboration and intelligence in such systems?

9ï¸âƒ£ LLM + enterprise system integration ğŸ§©
How complex is it to integrate LLM models with enterprise systems like CRMs, ERPs, or automation tools?
What tools are available to ensure traceability, explainability, and auditability?

ğŸ”Ÿ AI agent validation & certification ğŸ›¡ï¸
How do we validate the behavior of AI agents in production environments?
Is continuous evaluation more important than pre-deployment certification?

ğŸ“‹ Please refer to the full list of questions below, each one corresponding to the number indicated in the poll above.

1ï¸âƒ£ AI brain drain & research exodus ğŸŒ
With U.S. research funding cuts â€” especially from the DOGE â€” top scientists are leaving for better support abroad, accelerating a growing brain drain (Business Insider, May 2025).
Can AI meaningfully replace the loss of human scientific talent?
Could generative AI or autonomous research tools fill this gap â€” or are we overestimating what AI can do without the insight, creativity, and mentorship of human scientists?

2ï¸âƒ£ Explainability as a system property ğŸ§¢
As generative AI systems scale and integrate across domains (from content to decision-making tools), should we rethink â€˜explainabilityâ€™ as a system-level property rather than a model feature?
What new patterns or architectural shifts could support end-to-end traceability and contextual reasoning in increasingly modular and agentic AI environments?

3ï¸âƒ£ AI agent design debt risks âš™ï¸
As generative AI systems become increasingly agentic and capable of complex autonomous tasks, what design principles and architectural choices are essential to ensure maintainability and debuggability over time â€” especially to avoid the upfront efficiency gains being lost to long-term technical debt?

4ï¸âƒ£ AI in healthcare ethics & trust ğŸ¥
With the recent launch of Chinaâ€™s first AI hospital featuring 42 AI doctors, what are the potential ethical and practical challenges of AI-driven docs in our healthcare systems?
How can we ensure that AI doctors build trust, comply with regulations, and collaborate effectively with human healthcare providers?

5ï¸âƒ£ AI resistance in the workplace ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ’¼
What should managementâ€™s attitude be regarding employee resistance to AI?
Some companies are pushing AI-first strategies broadly â€” including tying AI usage to performance reviews. Is that the right way forward?

6ï¸âƒ£ AI coding tools arms race âš”ï¸
With OpenAIâ€™s Windsurf acquisition and Cursorâ€™s rise, which AI coding tools should we be aware of in the coming â€œarms raceâ€?

7ï¸âƒ£ Generative AI vs human judgment âš–ï¸
How is generative AI reshaping the balance between human judgment and machine output in healthcare and finance, and what should leaders prioritize for ethical, effective adoption?

8ï¸âƒ£ IBM/Amazon agent shift ğŸ› ï¸
How do IBMâ€™s and Amazonâ€™s recent AI agent announcements reflect the shift toward autonomous, task-specific agents? What are the implications for enterprise ecosystems and human developers?

9ï¸âƒ£ AI and the digital divide ğŸŒ
Are we at risk of deepening inequality by creating an â€œAI Dividendâ€ that primarily benefits the digitally empowered? How can AI bridge â€” not widen â€” the digital divide?

ğŸ”Ÿ Open source security concerns ğŸ”
How can we increase adoption of open source models in corporations despite concerns around sensitive data and security?

1ï¸âƒ£ Open source in enterprises ğŸ¢
What are minimum or sensible guardrails, prerequisites, or requirements that enterprises should implement to foster the use of open source models and make decision makers more comfortable using them?

2ï¸âƒ£ Multilingual AI inclusion ğŸŒ
In a world where AI shapes global communication, how can we ensure multilingualism and digital inclusion are embedded in AI systems from the start? What frameworks, data partnerships, or design choices could support low-resource languages and diverse perspectives?

3ï¸âƒ£ ISO-like governance in AI ğŸ“œ
How can ISO-like frameworks (e.g. ISO/IEC 42001) be applied to AI without stifling innovation? What design patterns balance certifiability with adaptiveness in dynamic environments?

4ï¸âƒ£ Autonomous AI agents in workflow ğŸ¤–
What should we consider when integrating AI agents that adapt to user workflows, collaborate with tools/people, and evolve over time in creative or technical systems?

5ï¸âƒ£ Agentic value: orchestration or data? ğŸ§ 
With model capabilities leveling, where is the most defensible value in agent-based systems â€” orchestration, context management, proprietary data, or something else?

ğŸ” Due to the character limitations imposed by the poll, I was unable to include the complete text of each question.

ğŸ“‹ Kindly refer to the comprehensive list of questions provided below, each corresponding to the number indicated above.

1ï¸âƒ£ As agents (and other tools) are increasingly employed in sensible environments (Social Security, Financial Services, Law Enforcement, â€¦) and handle sensitive data (e.g., Agent Pay by Mastercard), will we eventually need minimum standards/criteria these agents/tools must meet, or should this be left entirely to market participants? If standards would be beneficial, what criteria/minimum quality benchmarks (transparency, fairness, registration, security, â€¦) make sense, and which institutions could act as standard setters?

2ï¸âƒ£ The EU AI Act is often criticized for weak enforcement. From a technical or architectural perspective, what innovations or system-level designs could make such regulations more enforceable in practice?

3ï¸âƒ£ As generative AI models become more capable and autonomous, what governance frameworks or safeguards are essential to ensure responsible innovation without stifling creativity?

4ï¸âƒ£ As domain-specific AI applications and niche-use-case start-ups rapidly multiply, how do you think this trend will influence or impact the future of GenAI for enterprises and for individuals?

5ï¸âƒ£ Definition of teams in relation to AI â€” If AI continues to evolve as both tool and collaborator, how might this challenge our fundamental understanding of what constitutes a â€œteamâ€ in creative and technical contexts?

6ï¸âƒ£ With the rise of agentic AI and more specialized models, how do you see the roles of large and small models evolving in enterprise AI architectures? Follow-up Q: What are the identified and potential risks and biases regarding unsupervised decisions made by AAI?

7ï¸âƒ£ What are the standard best practices for designing AI systems with optimal memory utilization while minimizing computational and power overheadâ€”especially in light of the growing concern around energy constraints and sustainability in large-scale AI deployments? I have been part of AI automation for a year and havenâ€™t found the best capacity managerâ€”many times, adjustments are made ad-hoc based on requirements.
